title: US ambassador describes 'contentious' meeting with officials during Pelosi's visit
description: • Breakdown in US-China relations a 'manufactured crisis,' US ambassador says

title: How anti-abortion activists are pushing a post-Roe agenda
description: CNN's Elle Reeve talks to anti-abortion advocates in Boston who are working to modernize the movement following the fall of Roe v. Wade.

title: Black couple sues after they say home valuation rises nearly $300,000 when shown by White colleague
description: A Maryland couple has sued a local real estate appraiser and an online mortgage loan provider, alleging that the housing appraisal they received was unfairly low due to their race, in violation of the Fair Housing Act, after a second appraisal returned a result nearly $300,000 higher.

title: Rudy Giuliani is in freefall
description: How will we know when Rudy Giuliani hits rock bottom?

title: The world's second biggest movie theater chain is in trouble
description: The owner of Regal Cinemas is having a tough time — its stock crashed as much as 80% Friday after reports that its parent company is preparing to file for bankruptcy.

title: Iran drops key 'red line' demand as progress on a revived nuclear deal edges forward
description: Iran has officially dropped a key "red line" demand that had been a major sticking point in efforts to revive the Iran nuclear deal, a senior administration official told CNN.

title: White House officials privately concerned about classified material taken to Mar-a-Lago
description: White House officials have privately expressed deep concern over the tranche of classified material taken to former President Donald Trump's home in Florida, including some documents that are only meant to be viewed only in secure government facilities, CNN has learned.

title: Alec Baldwin speaks out about fatal shooting on movie set
description: Actor Alec Baldwin is speaking out to CNN amid new findings from the "Rust" shooting investigation. Baldwin maintains he never pulled the trigger and explains why he was scared former President Donald Trump could get him killed. CNN's Chloe Melas has more.

title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin takes drug test following partying backlash
description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin said on Friday that she had taken a drug test after a leaked video of her dancing with friends caused a stir, according to Finnish public broadcaster YLE.

title: Russia will once again shut off Europe's gas via Nord Stream 1 pipeline
description: Russia will halt gas supplies to Europe for three days at the end of the month via its main pipeline into the region, state energy giant Gazprom said on Friday, piling pressure on the region as it seeks to refuel ahead of winter.

title: 'ISIS Beatle' given 8 life sentences over hostage-taking, killing of Americans
description: El Shafee Elsheikh, a British ISIS fighter and member of the execution cell dubbed "the ISIS Beatles" because of their British accents, was sentenced to life in prison Friday for his role in the hostage-taking and deaths of four Americans and several others.

title: CEO famed for higher pay advocacy exits after sexual assault allegations
description: Dan Price was the poster child for resisting corporate greed, making headlines in 2015 for setting a minimum $70,000 salary for all employees at the payments company he led — saying he cut his own salary as CEO by 90% to achieve it.

title: Plane fails to descend as pilots 'fall asleep' during flight
description: Two pilots are believed to have fallen asleep and missed their landing during a flight from Sudan to Ethiopia on Monday.

title: 'I don't say his name, ever': Vulnerable Republicans seek to avoid Trump in 2022 midterms
description: The man in charge of the House GOP's campaign strategy has been doling out advice to Republican candidates and incumbents in key battleground races as they prepare for the general election: Don't be distracted by Donald Trump on the campaign trail, and instead focus on the issues Republicans believe will be most salient to voters in the midterms.

title: Former supermodel opens up about disfiguring cosmetic procedure
description: Former supermodel Linda Evangelista has opened up about the mental health toll of her disfiguring cosmetic procedure, telling British Vogue that she struggled with depression and at one point even stopped eating. The 57-year-old also revealed she had been influenced by repeated TV commercials, saying she would have refused the fat-freezing treatment if she had known that "side effects may include losing your livelihood and (ending) up so depressed that you hate yourself."

title: Why UK energy prices are rising much faster than in Europe
description: Millions of people in the United Kingdom are steeling themselves for colossal rises to their energy bills over the next few months, a coda to a year already marked by record price increases.

title: Soothe sciatica with these exercises
description: Often associated with low back pain, sciatica tends to be more of a pain in the butt -- and sometimes also the leg. That's because the pain travels along the sciatic nerves, the longest nerves in your body. Each sciatic nerve runs bilaterally from the base of your spine through the deep muscles of your buttocks and down the back of a leg.

title: Wayfair is cutting 5% of its global workforce
description: Wayfair is cutting nearly 900 jobs, or about 5% of the once-hot online retailer's global workforce, as it looks to regain its financial footing in a post-pandemic future.

title: Why the Middle East may be too hot to live in by the end of the century
'Miracles do happen': CNN speaks with family of injured Little Leaguer
description: According to an Instagram account set up to provide updates on injured Little Leaguer Easton Oliverson, the 12-year-old has been moved out of the ICU into a normal hospital room and has been able to stand up and feed himself both food and drinks. Oliverson was due to take part in the Little League Baseball World Series in Williamsport, Pennsylvania, but suffered a fractured skull after falling from a bunk bed at the players' dormitories. CNN's Jason Carroll reports.

title: Chinese city swabs freshly caught seafood for Covid-19
description: The Chinese coastal city of Xiamen is testing freshly caught fish, crabs and even shrimp for Covid-19 as it goes all out to contain a spiraling outbreak -- a policy drawing ridicule online and criticism from experts who say it's a "waste of resources."

title: See viral video showing Chinese authorities swabbing crabs for Covid-19
description: Videos showing workers in the coastal city of Xiamen testing fish and crabs have sparked ridicule as China maintains its zero-Covid policy.

title: Kid Cudi had a stroke while in rehab
description: Kid Cudi has shared he suffered a health crisis while in rehab in 2016.

title: DeLorean is back with its first prototype in 40 years
description: Legendary and long-defunct automaker DeLorean comes back with its all-electric prototype Alpha5. The newly-revived brand says it plans to put a version of the Alpha5 into production.

title: Couples are swapping out natural diamonds in rings for larger, cheaper lab-made ones
description: Lab-grown diamonds have become so popular with consumers that some couples are asking jewelers to swap the natural diamond in their rings for a lab-created sparkler.

title: Putin and Xi to attend G20 summit, setting up showdown with Biden
description: The leaders of China and Russia both plan to attend November's G20 summit, its host said Thursday, setting up a high-profile showdown with US President Joe Biden.

title: Must-watch videos of the week
Russia's version of Starbucks reopens with a new name and logo
description: A restaurateur and rapper duo unveiled Stars Coffee on Thursday, reopening the chain of coffee shops in Russia formerly owned by Starbucks, the latest major company rebranding after a months-long Western corporate exodus from the country.

title: Brooke Shields gets tearful as her daughter heads back to college
description: Brooke Shields says "the second time is not the charm" when it comes to waving goodbye to your college-bound child.

title: Researcher sees a 'dangerous' and significant shift by right-wing militia groups
description: The history of the movements against the U.S. government has deep roots on both the left and the right. Rachel Kleinfeld of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace tells Reality Check's John Avlon about a dangerous shift happening in the U.S. as right-wing militia movements are rallying against the government to defend former president Donald Trump.

title: For the first time, streaming is more watched than cable TV
description: The cord has been cut.

title: Lakes are drying up everywhere. Israel will pump water from the Med as a solution
Russia launches rockets from nuclear plant. See ex-worker's stark warning
description: CNN's Sam Kiley reports from Ukraine about mounting fears that Russian shelling could result in a nuclear disaster.

title: What travel was like before the internet
description: It's your first time in Eastern Europe, you don't speak the language, and you've no smartphone (or even cellphone). But you're confident because you have a terrific guidebook to... Yugoslavia?

title: New video shows Russian military vehicles inside Ukrainian nuclear plant
description: A new video shows Russia military vehicles sitting inside a turbine hall, connected to a nuclear reactor at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plan in Ukraine. It's unclear from the video whether the pallets and tent-like structures are Russian military, or are related to power plant operations. CNN's Sam Kiley reports.

title: 'Idotic, nonsensical': Legal expert refutes Trump's Mar-a-Lago claim
description: CNN legal analyst Areva Martin says former President Donald Trump's claim that he had a standing order to declassify any and all documents that he took to Mar-a-Lago is "idiotic and nonsensical from every standpoint."

title: Jonah Hill is taking a break from promoting films because of anxiety attacks
description: Actor and filmmaker Jonah Hill is stepping back from promoting his films, including his debut documentary, due to anxiety attacks.

title: Chinese-born Canadian billionaire given 13 years in prison
description: Chinese-Canadian tycoon Xiao Jianhua was sentenced Friday to 13 years in prison, more than five years after the billionaire was abducted from a hotel room in Hong Kong and taken to mainland China.

title: Caught on camera: Bull goes on rampage inside shop
description: A bull on the way to slaughter somehow escaped his transport and went wild in a shop, causing one person to be injured. CNN's John Vause reports.

title: China sets 'new normal' across Taiwan Strait
description: • Breakdown in US-China relations a 'manufactured crisis,' US ambassador says

title: Emirates airline suspends all flights to Nigeria as it struggles to repatriate funds
description: Nigeria's aviation ministry says it is "working hard" to release trapped funds to the Emirates airline after the carrier suspended flights to Nigeria beginning from next month.

title: North Korea rejects South's aid offer, calls President Yoon 'really simple'
description: North Korea has rejected South Korea's offer of economic support in exchange for denuclearization, saying the proposal suggests President Yoon Suk Yeol is "really simple," state media KCNA reported Friday.

title: Brazilian President Bolsonaro tries to grab cell phone from YouTube heckler, video shows
description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro got physical with a YouTuber who heckled him in the capital Brasilia on Thursday, according to video from Brazilian news station Globo.

title: They escaped a crisis in Afghanistan. Now they're living through another in the US
description: Shila rushes into the living room when she hears her nephew scream.

title: China tests everything for Covid, even wind from North Korea
description: China's fight against Covid has become an ideological campaign as science-based approaches are often sidelined. Authorities even censored a North Korean public health video that said mild Omicron cases can recover at home -- a policy that people in China praised as being more scientific. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: Underwater snow reveals new clues about Europa
description: Jupiter's icy moon Europa is an ocean world encased beneath a thick crust of ice -- a place where snow floats upward.

title: 6 takeaways from Thursday's court hearing over Mar-a-Lago search
description: A US magistrate judge started the process of potentially releasing some information from the affidavit that the Justice Department used to obtain a search warrant for former President Donald Trump's Florida residence.

title: Finnish PM says videos of her partying shouldn't have been made public
description: Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin has admitted to partying "in a boisterous way" after the release of private videos -- but said she is angry that the footage, which prompted criticism from political opponents, was leaked to the media.

title: 'Ludicrous,' 'a complete fiction': Ex-Trump officials say his declassification claim is nonsense
description: In the days since the FBI seized classified and top secret documents from Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort, the former President and his allies have claimed that Trump had a "standing order" to declassify documents he took from the Oval Office to the White House residence.

title: Myanmar to import Russian oil, military says
description: Military-ruled Myanmar plans to import Russian gasoline and fuel oil to ease supply concerns and rising prices, a junta spokesperson said, the latest developing country to do so amid a global energy crisis.

title: Maggie Haberman on possible reasons Trump took classified documents to Mar-a-Lago
description: The New York Times' Maggie Haberman explains the possible reasons why former President Donald Trump took classified documents to his Mar-a-Lago home.

title: Some Afghans say they're relieved after US troop withdrawal
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward is in the Tangi Valley, Afghanistan, where locals say they're relieved that US troops left.

title: Stunning images of nature's weird and wonderful unveiled in photo competition
description: A bubble-breathing lizard, shelter-seeking elephants and a ravenous bat are just a few of the images in a spectacular showcase of nature's weird and wonderful creatures unveiled in this year's BMC Ecology and Evolution Image Competition.
